title.narrative: African Republic Support to young change-makers to promote life skills and peace

description.narrative:
Through the program “Supporting Youth Change-Makers to Promote Life Skills and Peace,” Mercy Corps aims to engage urban youth in life-skills training and peace-building, supporting them to be champions of their own development and leaders in their communities. The project will contribute to the fulfillment of youth through the prevention of HIV/AIDS, the promotion of good health and hygiene, and the resolution of conflicts. Engaging local leaders, national partners and community members, Mercy Corps will carry out awareness raising campaigns to promote the participation of women and youth in peace-building as well as in public health and well-being.
Mercy Corps’ approach in the Central African Republic is to build the capacity of communities and local structures to ensure community buy-in and long-term sustainability. A pillar of this program is increasing the participation of local civil society, so that local leaders take an active role in community mobilization and awareness-raising. The objectives of the program are to: • Increase the knowledge of 25,000 urban youth of HIV/AIDS, life skills, hygiene, and peace building • Build the confidence and competence of youth through a tournament-style talent competition, using life-skills themes • Promote HIV/AIDS testing for 10,000 youth • Increase awareness and availability of condoms to 25,000 youth • Engage community organizations in outreach related to HIV/AIDS testing
